definition[0]: before the time by which it is necessary for something to be done
example[0]: Will you be able to finish it in time?
example[1]: We arrived at the concert hall in good time.
note[0]: in good time/in plenty of time
example[2]: They ran all the way to the corner just in time to see the bus disappearing up the street.
example[3]: The painting was successfully repaired in time for the opening of the exhibition.
definition[1]: after a certain period of time, especially after a gradual process of change and development
example[4]: He wants to see changes in the company and I am sure he will, in time.
